intro: Heterostemon simplicifolius, commonly known as the simple-leaved heterostemon, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers with four or five petals. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, and it produces small, fleshy fruits. Heterostemon simplicifolius is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests or along stream banks.
